input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.

Optional: Specifies the name of the interface for which you want to configure address and gateway information. The Interface Name parameter must match the name of the interface as specified in Network Connections. If InterfaceName contains spaces use "". Use IP address for Unix servers. On Unix servers the hostname or Ip address is used.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show </xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh interface ip delete arpcache</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> name="${interface name}"</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/sbin/arp -d</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${interface name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/arp -d</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface name}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${interface name}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Deletes an entry with a specific IP address, where InetAddr is the IP address. To delete an entry in a table for a specific interface, use the IfaceAddr parameter where IfaceAddr is the IP address assigned to the interface. To delete all entries, use the asterisk (*) wildcard character in place of InetAddr.
